snippet: Behind President Obama’s decision to extend the Iran nuclear negotiations is a calculation that the administration has the mix of pressure and incentives just about right.
abstract: News analysis; Obama administration believes agreement to a four-month extension of nuclear negotiations with Iran is strategic diplomacy; Congress, and some nuclear experts pushing for a harder line, strongly disagree, arguing that only more sanctions, more pressure and lurking threat of military action will get a final deal done.
lead_paragraph: Behind President Obama’s decision to extend the Iran nuclear negotiations is a calculation that the administration has the mix of pressure and incentives just about right.

headline.main: Staying the Course on Iran by Threatening Pain and Offering Relief
headline.print_headline: Staying the Course on Iran by Threatening Pain and Offering Relief
